text:
4 charged with DUI

LAWRENCEVILLE  Mark Anthony Aguierre-Vergara, 18, from East Meadow, N.Y. is
charged with eluding police, a felony, on May 24. Jihad Jahkim Prunty, the
passenger in the vehicle, is charged with possession of marijuana.

According to information provided Administrative Captain Brad Evans with the
Brunswick County Sheriff's Office, Lieutenant D. O. Jarrell was working
selective enforcement on Interstate 85 south at the 33-mile marker and saw a
Dodge Challenger and a 2017 BMW SUV traveling at a high rate of speed. The
Challenger was checked at 95 mph and the BMW was checked at 98 mph. Jarrell
initiated a traffic stop and notified dispatch. The Challenger reduced its
speed but the BMW increased its speed and attempted to elude. At times during
the pursuit Jarrell reached speeds between 140 mph and 147 mph. The vehicle
pulled to the right shoulder at the 27-mile marker. Jarrell detained Aguierre-
Vergara, the driver, and the passenger, Jihad Jahkim Prunty.

Jarrell advised the driver and the passenger that he could smell the odor of
marijuana coming from the vehicle. Prunty stated it was about 5 grams under
his seat. Prunty was charged with possession of marijuana.

Aguierre-Vergara was transported to the Meherrin River Regional Jail and taken
before the magistrate. Prunty was given a ride to Love's Truck Stop to get a
bus ticket. Aguierre-Vergara was charged with felony eluding and a summons was
issued for reckless speeding, 98 mph in a 70 mph zone. He was held under no
bond.

Juan Carlos Salazar Mota, 38, from Garner is charged with driving under the
influence of alcohol on May 30.

Evans said at approximately 3:13 p.m. Deputy A. W. Connell stopped a Honda van
on Highway 58 west at Reedy Creek Road driving 96 mph in a 55 mph zone. While
talking with the driver Connell could smell a strong odor of alcohol coming
from the driver's person. Mota said he had 2 or 3 beers earlier in the day.
Mota's 11-year-old son was a passenger. Mota was unsteady on his feet, his
speech was slurred and his eyes were glassy. Mota's 20-year-old son helped
with the communication barrier. Two breath samples were given, .24% BAC and
.22% BAC. Mota was arrested for DUI and taken to the Meherrin River Regional
Jail and blew .12% BAC. Mota was taken before the magistrate and charged with
DUI, reckless driving, 96 mph in a 55 mph zone; no valid operator's license
and felony child endangerment. He was also issued two seatbelt summonses. Mota
could not provide a fixed address and was held without bond.

Terrance Jermaine Williams, 29, from Warrenton, N.C. is charged with driving
under the influence of alcohol on May 25.

Evans said Sergeant D. W. Medlin stopped a vehicle on Interstate 85 at the
32-mile marker traveling 83 mph in a 70 mph zone. As he approached the vehicle
Medlin could smell a strong odor of alcoholic beverage coming from the
driver's area. There were two other occupants in the vehicle that claimed to
be drinking. Williams said he had been drinking and stated his last drink was
a couple of hours ago. After an investigation Williams was placed under arrest
for DUI.

Acrea Allen Pulley, 56, from Freeman is charged with driving under the
influence of alcohol on May 27 and refusal of blood or breath test.

Deputy A. W. Connell responded to an abandoned 911 call at 19112 Boydton Plank
Road, Warfield. The caller was a female possibly in danger in a vehicle.
Sergeant Daniel saw a vehicle pull away from the address and park in a yard
several houses down. The vehicle parked in the yard and not in the driveway.
Daniel and Connell approached the vehicle and found Pulley to be the driver.
They saw that Pulley was intoxicated. There was a strong odor of alcohol
coming from his person, his eyes were glassy, his speech was slurred and when
asked to step out of the vehicle, he used the door to keep his balance. After
the investigation Pulley was charged with DUI and refusal and held on a $1,000
secured bond.

Tyrell Leonard Cheatham, 35, from Lawrenceville is charged with driving under
the influence of alcohol on May 30.

Evans said Deputy A. W. Connell stopped a Mercury on Governor Harrison Parkway
east at the entrance to the brick plant for crossing the solid white line on
the right side of the highway 3 times. While talking with Cheatham, Connell
could smell a strong odor of alcohol coming from his person. Cheatham said he
had been drinking earlier in the day and took a nap before leaving for work at
the brick plant. He said when he woke up he poured a cup of gin to kill his
hangover. Cheatham agreed to give a breath sample and blew a .34% BAC. He
agreed to give another sample and blew a .33% BAC. He was transported to the
Meherrin River Regional Jail and later blew .20% BAC. Cheatham was taken
before the magistrate and charged with DUI. He was held on a $2,000 secured
bond and may be released when sober.

title: Felony eluding charge filed
html:
4 charged with DUI

LAWRENCEVILLE – Mark Anthony Aguierre-Vergara, 18, from East Meadow, N.Y. is charged with eluding police, a felony, on May 24. Jihad Jahkim Prunty, the passenger in the vehicle, is charged with possession of marijuana.

According to information provided Administrative Captain Brad Evans with the Brunswick County Sheriff's Office, Lieutenant D. O. Jarrell was working selective enforcement on Interstate 85 south at the 33-mile marker and saw a Dodge Challenger and a 2017 BMW SUV traveling at a high rate of speed. The Challenger was checked at 95 mph and the BMW was checked at 98 mph. Jarrell initiated a traffic stop and notified dispatch. The Challenger reduced its speed but the BMW increased its speed and attempted to elude. At times during the pursuit Jarrell reached speeds between 140 mph and 147 mph. The vehicle pulled to the right shoulder at the 27-mile marker. Jarrell detained Aguierre-Vergara, the driver, and the passenger, Jihad Jahkim Prunty.

Jarrell advised the driver and the passenger that he could smell the odor of marijuana coming from the vehicle. Prunty stated it was about 5 grams under his seat. Prunty was charged with possession of marijuana.

Aguierre-Vergara was transported to the Meherrin River Regional Jail and taken before the magistrate. Prunty was given a ride to Love's Truck Stop to get a bus ticket. Aguierre-Vergara was charged with felony eluding and a summons was issued for reckless speeding, 98 mph in a 70 mph zone. He was held under no bond.

Juan Carlos Salazar Mota, 38, from Garner is charged with driving under the influence of alcohol on May 30.

Evans said at approximately 3:13 p.m. Deputy A. W. Connell stopped a Honda van on Highway 58 west at Reedy Creek Road driving 96 mph in a 55 mph zone. While talking with the driver Connell could smell a strong odor of alcohol coming from the driver's person. Mota said he had 2 or 3 beers earlier in the day. Mota's 11-year-old son was a passenger. Mota was unsteady on his feet, his speech was slurred and his eyes were glassy. Mota's 20-year-old son helped with the communication barrier. Two breath samples were given, .24% BAC and .22% BAC. Mota was arrested for DUI and taken to the Meherrin River Regional Jail and blew .12% BAC. Mota was taken before the magistrate and charged with DUI, reckless driving, 96 mph in a 55 mph zone; no valid operator's license and felony child endangerment. He was also issued two seatbelt summonses. Mota could not provide a fixed address and was held without bond.

Terrance Jermaine Williams, 29, from Warrenton, N.C. is charged with driving under the influence of alcohol on May 25.

Evans said Sergeant D. W. Medlin stopped a vehicle on Interstate 85 at the 32-mile marker traveling 83 mph in a 70 mph zone. As he approached the vehicle Medlin could smell a strong odor of alcoholic beverage coming from the driver's area. There were two other occupants in the vehicle that claimed to be drinking. Williams said he had been drinking and stated his last drink was a couple of hours ago. After an investigation Williams was placed under arrest for DUI.

Acrea Allen Pulley, 56, from Freeman is charged with driving under the influence of alcohol on May 27 and refusal of blood or breath test.

Deputy A. W. Connell responded to an abandoned 911 call at 19112 Boydton Plank Road, Warfield. The caller was a female possibly in danger in a vehicle. Sergeant Daniel saw a vehicle pull away from the address and park in a yard several houses down. The vehicle parked in the yard and not in the driveway. Daniel and Connell approached the vehicle and found Pulley to be the driver. They saw that Pulley was intoxicated. There was a strong odor of alcohol coming from his person, his eyes were glassy, his speech was slurred and when asked to step out of the vehicle, he used the door to keep his balance. After the investigation Pulley was charged with DUI and refusal and held on a $1,000 secured bond.

Tyrell Leonard Cheatham, 35, from Lawrenceville is charged with driving under the influence of alcohol on May 30.

Evans said Deputy A. W. Connell stopped a Mercury on Governor Harrison Parkway east at the entrance to the brick plant for crossing the solid white line on the right side of the highway 3 times. While talking with Cheatham, Connell could smell a strong odor of alcohol coming from his person. Cheatham said he had been drinking earlier in the day and took a nap before leaving for work at the brick plant. He said when he woke up he poured a cup of gin to kill his hangover. Cheatham agreed to give a breath sample and blew a .34% BAC. He agreed to give another sample and blew a .33% BAC. He was transported to the Meherrin River Regional Jail and later blew .20% BAC. Cheatham was taken before the magistrate and charged with DUI. He was held on a $2,000 secured bond and may be released when sober.
